introduction.p: These exercises specifically refer to features of CoCalc possibly not present in other Sage installations.

exercise.title: Cell formatting
exercise.statement:
There are many different types of cell formatting mode commands which make the current cell of a Sage worksheet behave in a non-Sage way: primarily useful are the mode commands %md which creates a Markdown cell for unsophisticated text, %html which creates a HTML cell for web-formatted text (which generally you'll use Markdown to replicate!), and perhaps most importantly for a working mathematician, %latex which activates the full installation of CoCalc.

statement.p: Several things changed between the development of Python 2.7 and Python 3, and while many of them are minor changes some of those minor changes made parts of Sage not work correctly with Python 3; hence Sage uses Python 2. CoCalc can use both! You can use mode commands to change into a pure Python work space.
Investigate the difference between Python 2 and Python 3 by executing the command print "hello world!" in a worksheet cell formatted to %python and a cell formatted to %python3.
